title.narrative: SSR - UNDP Justice and Security Trust Fund II
SSR - UNDP Justice and Security Trust Fund II

description.narrative: Stöd till en UNDP administrerad multigivar trust fund som syftar till att stärka reformen av Liberias säkerhetssektor och rättsväsende.
Support to the UNDP administered Justice and Security Trust Fund with Liberia's security and justice sectors as beneficiaries.

The Justice and Security Program (JSP) sought to support the efforts of the Government of Liberia (GoL), through the Ministry of Justice and the Judiciary in the consolidation of reforms aimed at strengthening justice and security institutions. The Justice and Security Trust Fund (JSTF) was established in December 2009 and became operational in 2010. As a component of the JSP, the JSTF was established to strengthen the operational and technical capacity of justice and security institutions to support overall security sector reform. The JSTF also suported the transition plan of UNMIL and government of Liberia. More specifically, JSTF has provided institutional support to five key justice and security institutions:a) The Liberia Immigration Services (LIS) b) The Bureau of Corrections and Rehabilitation (BCR)c) Liberia National Police (LNP);d) The Prosecution Department of the Ministry of Justice (MoJ) including the specialized SGBV Crimes Unite) The Judiciary The JSTF has focused on supporting the following outcome areas: Outcome 1: Enhanced Institutional Capacity Development and Professionalization of Justice and Security Institutions Outcome 2: Improved infrastructure for Justice and Security institutions (LNP, BIN, Customs and DEA and Judiciary Outcome 3: Justice and Security Instructions’ Capacities Strengthened to Protect Border Points, Monitor Security and Respond to Crimes Outcome 4: Mechanisms for Effective prosecution of SGBV in Montserrado & Hub 1 strengthened

title.narrative: Justice and security trust fund II agreement amendment 2012
Justice and security trust fund II decision on contribution

description.narrative: Key results of the UNDP Justice and Security Trust Fund include: Completion of the construction of three magisterial courts in Nimba, Lofa and Montserrado Counties. Two pathologists successfully completed two years of studies (2015-2017) and support for final year of studies (2017/2018) provided. Improved human and community security and safety supported through training, and deployment of additional 398 (77 female, 321 male) new police officers across the country. Increased manpower capacity for BCR from two hundred and sixty-three (263) to four hundred seventy-two (472) through the training and deployment1 of additional 207 (35 female, 172 male) Corrections Officers; thus, increasing officers to inmates’ ratio from 1:8 in 2013 to 1:5 in 2017. Ensured the maintenance of security at the two main prison facilities in Zwedru, Grand Gedeh and Monrovia Central Prison in Montserrado County in the wake of UNMIL withdrawal by training and deploying 75 (65 males, 10 females) special intervention forces. Increased Liberia Immigration Service's (LIS) manpower capacity nationally from 2,347 to 2,597 through a three-month intensive training of additional 250 new LIS personnel (38 female & 212 Male). Increased the number of qualified magistrates nationwide from 60 to 120 for the 152 operating magisterial courts;One border post containing office and residential quarters constructed for LIS in Gbaota, Bong County; Improved prison facilities and enhanced mobility for BCR through renovation of the National Correction Palace in Grand Gedeh County; and Improved prosecution of SGBV crimes through support for the SGBV Crimes Unit in Montserrado and Gbarnga Regional Hub counties.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
